sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>grain</radical>s you have stored in your <radical>house</radical> reflect on your <kanji>earnings</kanji>. If you earn a lot of money, you have more grains.
meaningInfo: Imagine looking at the grains in the houses of people who make vastly different earnings. The poor artist has only a few sacks of grain. The rich samurai has an extra house just for holding his grain. That's how you know he has much higher earnings than the artist.
readingMnemonic: Another way to check someone's <kanji>earnings</kanji> is to see if they have a <reading>ca</reading>r (<ja>か</ja>). Would someone who doesn't make a lot of money have a car? No!
readingInfo: Picture your own earnings. Can you afford a lot of grains and a car?
